== MacBook 3,1 and Ubuntu 14.04.1 (Trusty) ==
<nowiki>[[File:MacBooksmall.png]]</nowiki><<BR>><<BR>>

This page aims to describe the steps needed, to fully enable all features of the '''3rd Generation Mac``Book''' (release date: late 2007) when using '''Ubuntu 14.04.1, Trusty Tahr'''.<<BR>>
<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/terminal.png]]</nowiki> You can find out, what model you have by typing at the terminal:<<BR>>
<pre>
sudo dmidecode -s system-product-name
</pre>
<<BR>>
 If you have a different model, please go <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/CommunityHelpPages|here]]</nowiki> and find the right wiki.

=== Basic Installation Instructions ===
Common things about installing and maintaining Ubuntu on Intel-based Macs:
<nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/AppleIntelInstallation|Intel CPU-based Macintosh Generic Installation Instructions]]</nowiki>

 1. - Resize OS X partition with Disk Utility<<BR>>
 2. - Boot Ubuntu Trusty installation media from USB flash drive<<BR>>
 3. - Run the installer and select to "install alongside OS X"<<BR>>
 4. - Boot into your fresh installation<<BR>>
 5. - Enable the Broadcom wireless drivers (STA) from the "Additional Drivers" dialogue<<BR>>
 6. - Enjoy Ubuntu!<<BR>>

=== Wireless (AirPort) ===

<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/restricted.png]]</nowiki>
This required manual installation of the Broadcom STA driver via Jockey, the Additional Drivers program.<<BR>>

=== Touchpad (appletouch) ===
Oddly, a finger tip will not engage mouse pointer movement. Instead, an entire finger segment must be laid down onto the touchpad in order for it to engage.
